content:
Diagnosis:
Jul 17 - 24mm grade III mixed invasive ductal and lobular carcinoma with clear margins on primary excision, ER strongly positive (8/8), PR weakly positive (2/8), HER2 negative (1+)

Aug 17 Commenced on adjuvant anastrozole. Initial tolerability issues with arthralgias led to switch to tamoxifen

Sep 17 Staging investigations revealed solitary lytic lesion in L3 vertebral body and 12mm left lower lobe pulmonary nodule

Oct 17 Completed palliative radiotherapy to L3 (30Gy in 10#) on 15.10.17

Commenced tamoxifen 20mg daily with monthly denosumab

Dec 17 Follow-up CT showed stable pulmonary nodule

May 18 Bone scan demonstrates no new sites of disease compared to baseline

New palpable abnormality in lateral aspect left breast, core biopsy confirmed 12mm Grade III recurrent invasive lobular carcinoma, margins clear but close (2mm)

CXR showed no obvious pulmonary disease

12.05.19 CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis showed no measurable disease, previous lung nodule no longer visible

28.06.19 Isotope bone scan showed unchanged appearance at L3, otherwise only degenerative changes noted

Lumbar spine imaging showed no new lytic disease

15.07.19 Changed from tamoxifen to fulvestrant

Completed adjuvant radiotherapy to left breast - developed grade 3 radiation dermatitis requiring brief treatment break, complicated by pre-existing psoriasis

30.08.19 MRI spine showed stable L3 metastasis, no evidence of new bone disease or cord compression

Diffuse degenerative changes noted throughout thoracolumbar spine

Jan 20 CT surveillance showed no evidence of progressive disease

Continuing fulvestrant

Jul 20 CT thorax/abdomen and bone scan confirmed stable disease

Maintained on fulvestrant with oral clodronate

18.11.20 Palliative radiotherapy to L3 vertebra (retreatment) for mechanical back pain

2022 Development of right-sided sciatica

Bone scan shows stable appearances

CT demonstrates no disease progression

To continue current endocrine therapy

Referral made to chronic pain service for consideration of nerve root block

Prescribed pregabalin with good symptomatic benefit

Mar 22 Bone scan showed only degenerative changes

Emergency admission to [redacted name] Hospital with community acquired pneumonia requiring HDU support

Dec 22 Maintained on fulvestrant and clodronate

Jan 24 Bone scan shows stable degenerative changes with area of increased uptake in right mandible ? osteonecrosis

Diffuse skeletal uptake considered non-specific

Dec 24 CT surveillance shows new subtle pulmonary nodules ? disease progression

Feb 25 Re-staging CT scan

15.03.25 MDT review confirmed pulmonary progression ? discontinue fulvestrant

22.03.25 Initiated on exemestane ? reasonable initial tolerance

18.05.25 Due cycle 3 exemestane

Surveillance imaging scheduled for June 2025

I was pleased to review [redacted name] in clinic today.
She is attending for assessment before her fourth cycle of exemestane.

Recent imaging confirms stable disease and clinical examination reveals no concerning features.

Her performance status remains 2 due to chronic mobility issues.

She will continue with current endocrine therapy.

Bloods have been drawn today and follow-up is arranged for four weeks.

All concerns were addressed during our discussion and appropriate safety-netting advice provided.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: 24mm grade III mixed invasive ductal and lobular carcinoma
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER strongly positive (8/8), PR weakly positive (2/8), HER2 negative (1+)
primary_cancer.metastases: lytic lesion in L3 vertebral body and left lower lobe pulmonary nodule

Changed from anastrozole to tamoxifen due to arthralgias

Completed palliative radiotherapy to L3 (30Gy in 10#)
Commenced tamoxifen 20mg daily with monthly denosumab
Follow-up CT showed stable pulmonary nodule
Bone scan demonstrates no new sites of disease compared to baseline

CXR showed no obvious pulmonary disease
CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis showed no measurable disease, previous lung nodule no longer visible
Isotope bone scan showed unchanged appearance at L3, otherwise only degenerative changes noted
Lumbar spine imaging showed no new lytic disease
Changed from tamoxifen to fulvestrant
Completed adjuvant radiotherapy to left breast - developed grade 3 radiation dermatitis requiring brief treatment break
MRI spine showed stable L3 metastasis, no evidence of new bone disease or cord compression
CT surveillance showed no evidence of progressive disease
CT thorax/abdomen and bone scan confirmed stable disease
Palliative radiotherapy to L3 vertebra (retreatment) for mechanical back pain
Bone scan shows stable appearances
CT demonstrates no disease progression
Bone scan showed only degenerative changes
Emergency admission to [redacted name] Hospital with community acquired pneumonia requiring HDU support
Bone scan shows stable degenerative changes with area of increased uptake in right mandible ? osteonecrosis
CT surveillance shows new subtle pulmonary nodules ? disease progression
Discontinued fulvestrant due to pulmonary progression
Initiated on exemestane

patient_facts.value: performance status remains 2 due to chronic mobility issues

status_updates.value: Metastatic hormone receptor positive breast cancer with 8-year disease history, multiple lines of endocrine therapy, and recent switch to exemestane after pulmonary progression. Currently stable on cycle 4 exemestane with maintained PS2 due to chronic mobility issues.
will continue with current endocrine therapy
follow-up is arranged for four weeks
